platform.game

Class Simulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • platform.game.Simulator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    World

    public class Simulator
extends java.lang.Object
implements World
    Basic implementation of world, managing a complete collection of actors.

      • hurt

        public int hurt(Box area,
                Actor instigator,
                Damage type,
                double amount,
                Vector location)
        Description copied from interface: World
        Sets a "hurting zone" in the World. Each actor entering this zone will be hurt by the Damage type.
        Specified by:
        hurt in interface World
        Parameters:
        area - it is the Box delimiting the zone
        instigator - the Actor instigating the Damage
        type - indicates which type of Damage is dealt
        amount - the amount (double) of damage dealt by the "attack"
        location - indicates where it comes from (Vector)
        Returns:
        the number (int) of "victims", aka Actors influenced by the attack

      • getGravityAngle

        public double getGravityAngle()
        Specified by:
        getGravityAngle in interface World
        Returns:

      • saveAll

        public void saveAll()
        Description copied from interface: World
        Used to call save() in Simulator. Circumvents the fact that the call would be issued in update itself...
        Specified by:
        saveAll in interface World

      • save

        public void save(boolean dynamicSave)

      • save

        private void save()
        Uses the fact that the classes are Serializable to save all Actors in a new folder located in "save/".

        Dynamically creates a new folder. Its numbering follows the others (increasing order). Part of the code was inspired by the one described on the mentioned website.

        See Also:
        Source website

      • load

        public void load(int world)
        Description copied from interface: World
        Uses the Serialized data created by save() to load a brand new level. Part of the code was inspired by the one described on the mentioned website:
        Specified by:
        load in interface World
        Parameters:
        world - Indicates which save is to be loaded (from 1 to 999)
        See Also:
        Source website
